intro: Cnidium anomalum, commonly known as the Indian snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish flowers. The plant contains various bioactive compounds, including coumarins and alkaloids, which contribute to its medicinal properties. It is often found in dry, open habitats and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Due to its chemical composition, it has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
